profile_data.summary:
Homepage: https://adyoussef.github.io/

I am a Machine Learning Researcher specializing in generative AI and large language models (LLMs) to advance scientific simulations. My work bridges advanced computational techniques with real-world applications, driving state-of-the-art solutions in AI and complex system modeling.

My research focuses on simulating particle collisions using generative models (VAEs, normalizing flows) and Message-Passing Graph Neural Networks (MPGNNs), enhancing simulation accuracy and computational efficiency. Beyond scientific applications, I leverage LLMs (GPT, OPT) and Vision-Language Models (VLMs) to:

•  Enhance multimodal reasoning and model robustness using retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and representation learning.
•  Improve model generalization and performance, ensuring transparent and trustworthy AI systems.
•  Advance state-of-the-art AI techniques for multimodal applications and robust model design.

Skills:

•  Programming Languages/Systems: Python, C++, SQL, Spark, Git, Docker, Linux, Bash scripting
•  Frameworks & Libraries: PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, HuggingFace, NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, OpenCV
•  Technologies & Tools: Large-Scale ML Training, LLM Fine-Tuning & Inference, High-Performance Computing (HPC), Parallel & Distributed Systems
• Research & Engineering Expertise: Generative AI (VAEs, Normalizing Flows, Diffusion Models), AI Explainability, Model Optimization, Reinforcement Learning
•  Soft Skills: Research Leadership, Technical Writing, Multilingual (English, German, Arabic)
profile_data.headline: Machine Learning Researcher | Generative AI & LLMs | Advancing Scientific Simulations & Multimodal Reasoning

experience.description:
• Led ML-based particle collision simulations using Generative Models (VAE, Normalizing Flows), adopted by 10k+ researchers globally
•  Developed a Monte Carlo reweighting framework, improving simulation accuracy and increasing computational speed by 3-4x
•  Designed a test statistic for CERN collider experiments, impacting 1,000+ datasets and advancing scalable ML systems for high-dimensional data analysis
•  Applied machine learning techniques to solve large-scale data analysis challenges, contributing to multimodal reasoning and predictive modeling
experience.title: Research Assistant | Machine Learning Researcher – Generative AI & Scientific Simulations

experience.companyName: University of Cincinnati's Center for Entrepreneurship
experience.description:
• Led product-oriented AI research, accelerating development and securing $7,500 in funding through the Lab2Market Fellowship and New Venture Championship
•   Refined AI-driven startup concepts and developed go-to-market strategies for computer vision and ML solutions, driving real-time manufacturing optimization
•   Developed a computer vision-based quality control system, achieving high classification accuracy and enabling scalable AI solutions for edge computing and real-time inference
• Collaborated across interdisciplinary teams, bridging ML research and product development, advancing AI applications for supply chain and manufacturing
experience.title: Entrepreneurial Engagement

experience.description: Quantum Field Theory (QFT)  -- Concepts include modern quantum field theory, including the quantization of free fields and gauge fields, perturbative techniques, and the renormalization group.
experience.title: Teaching Assistant

experience.description:
•  Collaborated with the High Energy Theory group to compute the latest constraints on Dark Matter with Dipole Interaction
•   Applied advanced statistical methods, including confidence intervals, to refine the bounds on these measurements

Postdoctoral researcher at University of Amsterdam

projects.description:
● Project resulted from the EEML 2022 summer school organized by Google DeepMind
● Proposed a method to "hack" pre-trained generative models to generate completely new outputs
● Enhanced a Butterfly GAN by integrating a bending module to selectively train specific layers while keeping the rest of the architecture frozen
● Different bending modules include the use of the CLIP model with a contrastive loss to align text prompts and images, and a differential sorting module that learns to permute rows of the activation tensor
projects.title: Hacking Generative Models with Differentiable Network Bending, resulted in Publiation at NeurIPS 2023 ML for Creativity and Design

projects.description:
● Developed a novel text style transfer method using large language models (LLMs) like OPT and GPT-3, focusing on unsupervised inference to generate fluent, context-aware text transformations
● Achieved 84% classification accuracy and state-of-the-art fluency scores in few-shot learning for
summarization and sentiment analysis
projects.title: Few-Shot Abstractive Summarization for Style Transfer, resulted in Publication at ICNLP 2023
